Fish can survive outside of their habitat

Why is the right posture important?

answers: Puts unnecessary pressure on your spine
Evenly distributes the weight on your spine
Keeps you comfortable and reduces injury risk
Allows you to maintain a full range of motion
content.answer: Puts unnecessary pressure on your spine

content.prompt: How does your posture change over time?
answers: Your posture will change depending on how you maintain it
As you grow old, your spine will form a permanent curve
Over time, your spine will become straighter due to stronger muscles
content.answer: Your posture will change depending on how you maintain it

content.title: common:sorting

Look inside your backpack and see what you can reduce, reuse, recycle, and digitalize. Let‚Äôs try to make your backpack lighter and save the planet by using less paper!

reducing the amount of oxygen in the air.
trapping more heat in the atmosphere.

content.prompt: Which is a natural source of greenhouse gasses?
What is the greenhouse effect?
answers: The warming of a planet due to trapped radiation.
The cooling of Earth due to air pollution.
The heating of a solid, such as a rock.
content.answer: The warming of a planet due to trapped radiation.

content.prompt: There is nothing we can do to stop water pollution.

answers: Sweat from our bodies on hot days
Warm rain but not cold snow or sleet
Gas that we use in furnaces or ovens
Any form of water that falls from the sky
content.answer: Any form of water that falls from the sky

content.prompt: Which example is a form of precipitation?

answers: the movement of water on, above, or below the surface of the Earth

answers: The children do not move at all

content.prompt: What subject of physics is being studied as our primary energy source?

content.text: Nothing in the world can move until there is a force either pushing or pulling it. Therefore, objects can only move when there is a force applied to them.

answers: Use the speed of animals to generate energy like a hamster spinning on a wheel
The speed of animals cannot be used to generate energy
Use the speed of animals to generate energy like sitting on a cheetah running back and forth
Although using animals for energy can be done, it is unethical and shouldn‚Äôt be done
content.answer: Although using animals for energy can be done, it is unethical and shouldn‚Äôt be done

content.prompt: How many legs are needed to run fast?
answers: 2, the less legs the faster you can run
4, the more legs the faster you can run
0, wings can help you fly faster than run
It does not depend on the amount of legs
content.answer: It does not depend on the amount of legs

lessons.title: 4. How Much Does an Elephant Weigh?

content.title: common:snapshot

content.title: common:imageboom
content.prompt: Find one of the heaviest objects in your house. What is it made out of? Try to identify the composition of materials and then label each material as either environmentally friendly or not. Try your best!

content.title: common:reorder
content.prompt: Put these objects in order from lightest to heaviest
Mass is hard to estimate when it comes to visually objects that we‚Äôve never seen before. How heavy do you think a whale‚Äôs tongue is?
answers: Heavier than an elephant, bike, and a human combined
Heavier than a bike and a human
Not heavier than any of these listed above
content.answer: Heavier than an elephant, bike, and a human combined

content.prompt: If two objects are hit with the same force, which object will roll faster?
answers: The object that has a more rectangular shape
None of the objects because they are hit with the same force

content.prompt: Do different countries have different measurement standards?
Which of these do not belong?
When it comes to making everyday objects, we should _____.
answers: Use less mass in order to save materials and be sustainable
Use more mass in order to use more materials and be sustainable
Use less mass because it is cheaper and spending less is sustainable
Use less mass because spending less and saving materials are both sustainable
content.answer: Use less mass because spending less and saving materials are both sustainable

content.title: common:mastery
content.prompt: Now that you understand how this works, we‚Äôll compare different energy sources to each other. Some energy sources need less area and less mass to be effective than others. Research and describe the different energy sources and their requirements in terms of area and mass.

content.text: Objects of different mass will react differently when the same force is applied to them. The object with more mass will gain less speed than the object with less mass.
Ask a friend to help you in this activity. Take turns applying similar forces to different objects.

content.text: A ray of sunlight moves in a straight line and changes its behavior as it hits different objects. Some objects such as metal, wood, and stone absorb most of the light and do not allow it to pass through them.

content.title: common:imageboom
content.prompt: What is the difference between natural sources of sound and artificial sources of sound? How can we use natural sources of sound for sustainable behaviors?

content.title: common:sorting
content.prompt: Sort the sounds
What is a sustainable source of sound?
answers: A rooster making noise to wake you up in the morning
A speaker making louder, disruptive noise for everyone to hear
A car revving its engine releasing gasses into the air
content.answer: A rooster making noise to wake you up in the morning

content.prompt: Is sound a form of energy?
How is sound produced?
answers: Forward and backward movement called oscillation and the vibrations that propagate through the air are these sound waves.
From a speaker located deep inside Earth‚Äôs core
The Earth‚Äôs gravitational pulls waves to the center and pushes them out loudly
content.answer: Forward and backward movement called oscillation and the vibrations that propagate through the air are these sound waves.

content.prompt: Can sound be amplified?
What can lead to deafness?
answers: Loud noise from a construction site

content.title: common:mastery
content.prompt: Identify loud noises and record their source, explanation, and loudness relative to each other in a notepad. Explain which sounds could be eliminated or reduced.

content.text: The sounds you hear tell you what is going on. Nowadays, there is a massive amount of sound pollution.

Did you know that shouting in someone‚Äôs ear can lead to deafness? Loud sounds near the eardrums over time can damage your hearing as well. We have to eliminate sound pollution and it can start from inside the household.

content.title: common:mastery
content.prompt: Go outside and find three different animals. Take note of how they react to sound. Try and understand why they hear sounds in the manner that they do. Is it an evolutionary process? How does it help them maintain their lifestyle?

content.text: We all hear sounds differently. Animals, plants, and humans can all hear sounds.

content.title: common:mastery
content.prompt: Describe why different plants, animals, and humans live in different temperatures.

content.text: Get a thermometer. Visit a nearby park and find three different plants.
Record the temperature of the leaves of the plants. Record the temperature of the soil of the plants. Identify any patterns for these plants in accordance with the temperature and their growth.

lessons.title: 10. Where Does Frost Hide During the Summer?

content.title: common:imageboom
content.prompt: Ask your parents about summer and winter temperatures when they were kids. Compare it to the temperatures right now. Do you notice any differences?

content.title: common:snapshot
content.prompt: Take a picture of things that help us keep cooler in summer

content.title: common:sorting
content.prompt: Sort the animals based on their environment
What is likely to result from global warming?
When weather patterns change over a long period of time, we call it ___
What is the main gas that is trapping more heat close to the Earth, acting like a blanket?
Climate change causes extreme weather conditions such as:
Which human activity contributes the MOST carbon dioxide to the atmosphere?
Possible human solutions for limiting global warming and climate change are‚Ä¶
answers: Removing carbon from fossil fuel emissions

content.prompt: Melting land ice‚Ä¶
answers: Causes sea levels to rise because it adds water to the ocean.
Does not cause sea levels to rise because the water fills the space left by the melted sea ice.
content.answer: Causes sea levels to rise because it adds water to the ocean.

content.prompt: Why does cutting down trees increase global warming?
answers: Trees provide shade which counteracts global warming
Trees absorbs the sun's energy without radiating back into the atmosphere
Trees drain greenhouse gasses like methane from soil

content.title: common:mastery
content.prompt: Go outside to your nearest park. Understand how many animals keep cool in the summer or keep warm in the winter depending on the climate. Describe how changes to our body could help us keep climate in control similarly to them.

content.text: When people think of warmth, they think of sunny, summer days. Or you could think about cold, winter days with the heater on. Regardless, heat is a form of energy that is always being generated. However, generating heat in the winter can cost energy and leave a massive carbon footprint. Generating cold in the summer can cost energy and leave a massive carbon footprint.

content.title: common:snapshot
content.prompt: Take pictures of the devices where magnets are used

content.title: common:imageboom
content.prompt: Are magnets environmentally friendly? Explain your answer.
What is a magnet?
answers: A magnet is a material that attracts wood, rubber, and glass.
A magnet is a material that attracts certain metals, such as iron, nickel, and cobalt.
A magnet has two poles, the north pole and the south pole.
A magnet has two poles, the west pole and the east pole
content.answer: A magnet has two poles, the north pole and the south pole.

content.prompt: 3. Magnets attract all types of metals.
5. Identify the correct statement.
answers: Magnets can pull through liquids, solids, and gasses.
Magnets will not attract items when blocked by liquids, solids, and gasses.
content.answer: Magnets can pull through liquids, solids, and gasses.

content.prompt: 6. Which toy would a magnet attract?

content.title: common:sorting

content.title: common:mastery
content.prompt: Find a magnet and test its magnetism on different objects around the house. Record your observations. Now that you‚Äôve done this, describe different ways you could use magnets.

content.text: Magnets are objects that can attract or repel other objects. They are present and are found around the world. There are many objects around the household that are magnetic that you may not know about.

content.title: common:mastery
content.prompt: Look through all the previous lessons and gather some ideas. Use only one lesson as your main inspiration but you can take ideas from all of them. Foster your own Mastery üéì challenge and make sure that at the end of the exercise your parents learn something. Take pictures, videos, and notes, and record all your observations. Great job scientists!

content.text: Your long summer vacation is about to begin. You‚Äôve done a lot of sustainability research during the year, but there‚Äôs more. This time you will create a sustainability exercise for your parents.
